article_text:
When Chuck Schumer feels compelled to dial up a grouchy conference call with the press, it usually means Republicans are doing something right.

In this case what’s right is a strategy by the Republican Senate, which is refusing to confirm a slew of President Obama’s nominees to key posts. GOP senators are issuing “holds” on appointees and explaining that they will continue until the administration accedes to specific demands. Judging...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Kimberley A. Strassel writes about the GOP’s submission hold: Blocking Obama’s appointees is one way to counter overreach and stonewalling.
twitter.title: The GOP’s Submission Hold

og.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Kimberley A. Strassel writes about the GOP’s submission hold: Blocking Obama’s appointees is one way to counter overreach and stonewalling.
og.title: The GOP’s Submission Hold

article_metadata.author: Kimberley A. Strassel

article_summary:
GOP senators are issuing “holds” on appointees and explaining that they will continue until the administration accedes to specific demands.
In this case what’s right is a strategy by the Republican Senate, which is refusing to confirm a slew of President Obama’s nominees to key posts.
When Chuck Schumer feels compelled to dial up a grouchy conference call with the press, it usually means Republicans are doing something right.
